results.title: The Right to be heard
results.creator_credit: Louise Hubbard, Kay Donovan and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
Examines every person’s right to understand what occurs in court regardless of language. The use of interpreters is one way of overcoming this disadvantage.

results.title: The Right stuff
results.creator_credit: The Ladd Company, Warner Bros Pictures, Irwin Winkler, Robert Chartoff and Philip Kaufman
results.brief_description: Based on Tom Wolfe’s best seller, “The Right Stuff” recounts the development of the American Space programme. Spanning 15 years, the film begins with Chuck Yeager breaking the sound barrier and moves on to concentrate primarily on the original seven Mercury astronauts. The film relates the perils and frustrations of the astronauts, their arduous training and complex personal lives, and the absurd lengths to which they must go to satisfy the public’s demand for real heroes. Cast includes Sam Shepard, Scott Glenn, Ed Harris, Dennis Quaid, Fred Ward and Barbara Hershey.

results.title: The Right person for the job
results.brief_description: Excerpts from a seminar held on equal rights legislation held at Trinity College, Melbourne University, are interspersed with dramatisations of problems which women face in the workforce. Shows the role of the conciliation officer and the hearing of a discrimination case by the Equal Opportunity Board

results.title: The Right line
results.creator_credit: Ronald H. Riley, R.H.R. Productions, David Cobham and Noel Cunningham Reid
results.brief_description: To attain championship class in motor-cycle racing, the enthusiast gains experience in many aspects of the sport, ranging from rough country scrambles to international Grand Prix. Points out The right line for keen motor-cyclists to follow and shows many exciting events taking place. Highlights include the 1960 Junior TT race in the Isle of Man, and the 1960 German Grand Prix won by Gary Hocking from Bulawayo.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ronald H. Riley, R.H.R. Productions, David Cobham and Noel Cunningham Reid

results.title: The Right instrument?
results.creator_credit: Alasdair Clayre, Open University and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: Gerald Hendrie talks about authenticity of text and performance in music and illustrates his argument with performances of Bach’s and Handel’s music on clavichord, harpsichord, piano, 17th century organ and “romantic” organ.
results.description: Gerald Hendrie talks about authenticity of text and performance in music and illustrates his argument with performances of Bach’s and Handel’s music on clavichord, harpsichord, piano, 17th century organ and “romantic” organ.

results.title: The Right ingredients
results.creator_credit: Australian Bicentennial Authority, Department of Sport and Recreation, Arts Victoria, Victoria. Ministry of Education, Australian Film Commission, George Cass and Chris O'Rourke
results.brief_description: A look behind the scenes of the Australian Ballet School and the preparations of blocking the dancers in the classroom to the final performance. We see students rehearsing and dancing to the modern ballet “Signatures” and the classical ballet “The Nutcracker”. Contains commentary from Dame Margaret Scott and Kevin Coe.

results.title: The Right approach [B&W]
results.brief_description: Stresses the importance of the right opening in getting the retail sale off to a smooth start. Also shows how the attitude of the sales staff can create a welcoming atmosphere throughout the entire store by being affable and cheerful in their manner.

results.title: The Ridge
results.creator_credit: Angela Borelli, Janet McLeod, Australian Broadcasting Corporation, Film Victoria and Two-Up Films
results.brief_description: Outback New South Wales there’s a town where dreams can either be made or broken - a place that is harsh and dusty and sometimes unforgiving to those who dig its soil for the elusive gem that will hopefully one day make them rich. Lightning Ridge is one of Australia’s better-known opal fields, rich in history and highly regarded for its unique black opal. This documentary film follows the daily routine of some of those miners who have made the “Ridge” their home, and through their personal stories we learn just how dedicated and determined they can be in the belief that one day they will find the “big one”. Opal mining can be tedious, exciting or just plain hard work but at the Ridge, a town where men outnumber women by six to one, there is a shared camaraderie that unites the community, regardless of who you are or where you come from.

results.title: The Rideau: Colonel By's peaceable waterway
results.creator_credit: International Cinemedia Centre, Joseph Koenig, George Kaczender and Marc Champion
results.brief_description: A look at the history of the Rideau Canal — its original military purpose, its painstaking contruction between 1826 and 1831, its effects on the land around and on Canada as a whole. The film combines old drawings and actual footage, contemporary commentary and voices from the past, to reveal the technological and human sides of one of Canada’s greatest engineering achievements.
